data.title: individual kerning is wrong
data.body: `_horizontalKernings[index]` contains the amount of kerning between the letter at index and the next letter, so adding 1 to index is wrong

data.body: Merge cocos2d/cocos2d-x

data.title: Add support for Unsigned with CCValue
data.body: This is meant to support getting and storing unsigned values into the Value class. The instigator of adding this is to fix a bug in TMX Tiled parser where flipped/rotated GIDs are not parsed correctly as they're larger than MAX_INT.

As mentioned in https://github.com/cocos2d/cocos2d-x/pull/13779

This is an example of issue this can cause

data.title: add CCGLProgram function binding setUniformLocationWithMatrix
data.body: add CCGLProgram function binding setUniformLocationWithMatrix

data.title: Sprite3D Material refactor
Fix Chipmunk setCollisionType issue by initializing variables
data.body:
setCollisionType will create a cpCollisionType(long) type variable to store a JS unsigned int value, as it's not initialized, jsval_to_uint will only modify its low bit values, then the final result will be wrong.

There are many other variables not initialized in JSB codes, I modified all that matters in chipmunk binding codes.

data.title: user dynamic_cast instead of static_cast in Scheduler
data.body: A node could has selector & callback scheduler at same time, so should use dynamic_cast instead of static_cast when get element from timers in Scheduler.

data.title: Label BUG if label's maxLineWidth != 0 and label's scale != 1
data.body: There is a bug in Label when setting a _maxLineWidth other than 0 and the Label scale is not 1. The lines width are always computed for the scale value of 1, and it will not display correctly. If the scale is less than 1, then the text appears narrower than it should, and if the scale is greater that 1, then it's wider. I just upgraded my project from v3.3 to v3.8 and noticed this bug.

data.title: Remove performance tests from lua-tests & js-tests.
add lua_cocos2dx_ActionFloat_create to lua_cocos2dx_manual.cpp
data.body:
lua_cocos2dx_ActionFloat_createlua_cocos2dx_manual.cpp

```
    local sequence = transition.sequence({
        cc.DelayTime:create(event.delayTime),
        cc.ActionFloat:create(event.scaleTime,scale_from,scale_to,function( scale )
            local default_zeye = cc.Director:getInstance():getZEye()

            local zeye = default_zeye/scale

            local size = cc.Director:getInstance():getWinSize()
            local eye = cc.vec3(size.width/2, size.height/2.0, zeye)

            cc.Camera:getDefaultCamera():setPosition3D(eye);
        end)
    })
   v:runAction(sequence)
```

cc.ActionFloat:createcocos2d-xlua

data.title: Chipmunk's addCollisionHandler doesn't work using JSB
data.body:
1. Download cocos2d-x v3.8 final
2. `cd tests/js-tests/`
3. `cocos run -p mac` (I'm using El Capitano beta)
4. Go to "Chipmunk test" in launched app
5. Go to "Chipmunk Collision test"
6. There is no "Collision detected" text in test: http://take.ms/uKbPp

Other thoughts: 
1. It doesn't work on all native platforms because of issue in chipmunk's manual binding cpp code
2. setDefaultCollisionHandler works fine

data.title: Windows Platform need static link library
data.body:
All other platform use static link, only windows use dynamic link.
For PC version it is not so important, but WinRT necessary.

Example: 
Dynamic link need
glew32.dll
iconv.dll
libcocos2d.dll
libcurl.dll
libeay32.dll
libidn-11.dll
libmpg123.dll
libogg.dll
libtiff.dll
libvorbis.dll
libvorbisfile.dll
OpenAL32.dll
sqlite3.dll
ssleay32.dll
websockets.dll
zlib1.dll
And 
msvcp100.dll
msvcp110.dll
msvcr100.dll
msvcr110.dll
For support PC not istall visual studio redistributable 2013 and 2012

If build in visual studio 2015, need necessarily redistributable 2015 (Not support only msvcp130.dll msvcr130.dll)

Common size dlls: 15.4 MB
My app.exe size 1.3 MB

If i build app in static link, common size my app: 4 MB ( 23% )

Question visual studio 2015 is topical!

I suggest build all 3rd party libs as static library, and use /MT runtime library(visual studio 2015 not support msvcp130.dll msvcr130.dll, only redistributable 2015)

data.title: [JS-plugin-FB] FAILS in release mode
data.body:
Works great in debug but in release mode it throws:

```
plugin.FacebookAgent.getInstance is not a function
```

I've double checked that this is called:

```
    sc->addRegisterCallback(register_all_pluginx_protocols);
    sc->addRegisterCallback(register_pluginx_js_extensions);
    SDEBUG(LEVEL_INFO, "app", "FB JS-support ENABLED", "");
```

The log shows the `FB JS-support ENABLED` message.
Any hint how could I identify the problem? 
I've put several log dump messages inside the `js_register_pluginx_protocols_FacebookAgent` to make sure it is called and it is...

I've tried it with cocos 3.5, 3.7 and 3.8 and all have this same issue.

I know that plugins are not a prio since there is SDKBOX now, but this functionality doesn't work properly on SDKBOX, please support the plugins till the SDKBOX is mature enough.

It seems that the JS compilation messes this, could it be? Note that I use in 3.5 JS compilation from 3.7.1. which fixes the bug with JS source code included.
UPDATE: I've tried it with original 3.5 JS compiler and the bug is still there....
